member.name: M:System.Text.Decoder.Reset
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the decoder back to its initial state.

member.name: T:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback
member.summary: Provides a failure-handling mechanism, called a fallback, for an encoded input byte sequence that cannot be converted to an input character. The fallback throws an exception instead of decoding the input byte sequence. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback.CreateFallbackBuffer
member.summary: Returns a decoder fallback buffer that throws an exception if it cannot convert a sequence of bytes to a character.
member.returns: A decoder fallback buffer that throws an exception when it cannot decode a byte sequence.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the current object and a specified object are equal.
member.returns: true if is not null and is a object; otherwise, false.
member.param: An object that derives from the class.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback.GetHashCode
member.summary: Retrieves the hash code for this instance.
member.returns: The return value is always the same arbitrary value, and has no special significance.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderExceptionFallback.MaxCharCount
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of characters this instance can return.
member.returns: The return value is always zero.

member.name: T:System.Text.DecoderFallback
member.summary: Provides a failure-handling mechanism, called a fallback, for an encoded input byte sequence that cannot be converted to an output character.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallback.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallback.CreateFallbackBuffer
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, initializes a new instance of the class.
member.returns: An object that provides a fallback buffer for a decoder.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallback.ExceptionFallback
member.summary: Gets an object that throws an exception when an input byte sequence cannot be decoded.
member.returns: A type derived from the class. The default value is a object.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallback.MaxCharCount
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the maximum number of characters the current object can return.
member.returns: The maximum number of characters the current object can return.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallback.ReplacementFallback
member.summary: Gets an object that outputs a substitute string in place of an input byte sequence that cannot be decoded.
member.returns: A type derived from the class. The default value is a object that emits the QUESTION MARK character ("?", U+003F) in place of unknown byte sequences.

member.name: T:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer
member.summary: Provides a buffer that allows a fallback handler to return an alternate string to a decoder when it cannot decode an input byte sequence.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.Fallback(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, prepares the fallback buffer to handle the specified input byte sequence.
member.returns: true if the fallback buffer can process ; false if the fallback buffer ignores .
member.param: An input array of bytes.
The index position of a byte in .

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.GetNextChar
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves the next character in the fallback buffer.
member.returns: The next character in the fallback buffer.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.MovePrevious
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, causes the next call to the method to access the data buffer character position that is prior to the current character position.
member.returns: true if the operation was successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.Remaining
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of characters in the current object that remain to be processed.
member.returns: The number of characters in the current fallback buffer that have not yet been processed.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackBuffer.Reset
member.summary: Initializes all data and state information pertaining to this fallback buffer.

member.name: T:System.Text.DecoderFallbackException
member.summary: The exception that is thrown when a decoder fallback operation fails. This class cannot be inherited.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: An error message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Parameters specify the error message, the array of bytes being decoded, and the index of the byte that cannot be decoded.

The input byte array.
The index position in of the byte that cannot be decoded.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderFallbackException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Parameters specify the error message and the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
member.param: An error message.
The exception that caused this exception.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallbackException.BytesUnknown
member.summary: Gets the input byte sequence that caused the exception.
member.returns: The input byte array that cannot be decoded.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderFallbackException.Index
member.summary: Gets the index position in the input byte sequence of the byte that caused the exception.
member.returns: The index position in the input byte array of the byte that cannot be decoded. The index position is zero-based.

member.name: T:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback
member.summary: Provides a failure-handling mechanism, called a fallback, for an encoded input byte sequence that cannot be converted to an output character. The fallback emits a user-specified replacement string instead of a decoded input byte sequence. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a specified replacement string.
member.param: A string that is emitted in a decoding operation in place of an input byte sequence that cannot be decoded.
member.exception: is null.
contains an invalid surrogate pair. In other words, the surrogate pair does not consist of one high surrogate component followed by one low surrogate component.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.CreateFallbackBuffer
member.summary: Creates a object that is initialized with the replacement string of this object.
member.returns: A object that specifies a string to use instead of the original decoding operation input.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.DefaultString
member.summary: Gets the replacement string that is the value of the object.
member.returns: A substitute string that is emitted in place of an input byte sequence that cannot be decoded.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Indicates whether the value of a specified object is equal to the object.
member.returns: true if is a object having a property that is equal to the property of the current object; otherwise, false.
member.param: A object.

member.name: M:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.GetHashCode
member.summary: Retrieves the hash code for the value of the object.
member.returns: The hash code of the value of the object.

member.name: P:System.Text.DecoderReplacementFallback.MaxCharCount
member.summary: Gets the number of characters in the replacement string for the object.
member.returns: The number of characters in the string that is emitted in place of a byte sequence that cannot be decoded, that is, the length of the string returned by the property.

member.name: M:System.Text.Encoding.GetEncoding(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the encoding associated with the specified code page identifier.
member.returns: The encoding that is associated with the specified code page.
member.param: The code page identifier of the preferred encoding. Possible values are listed in the Code Page column of the table that appears in the class topic.-or- 0 (zero), to use the default encoding.
member.exception: is less than zero or greater than 65535.
is not supported by the underlying platform.
is not supported by the underlying platform.

member.name: M:System.Text.Encoding.GetEncoding(System.Int32,System.Text.EncoderFallback,System.Text.DecoderFallback)
member.summary: Returns the encoding associated with the specified code page identifier. Parameters specify an error handler for characters that cannot be encoded and byte sequences that cannot be decoded.
member.returns: The encoding that is associated with the specified code page.
member.param: The code page identifier of the preferred encoding. Possible values are listed in the Code Page column of the table that appears in the class topic.-or- 0 (zero), to use the default encoding.
An object that provides an error-handling procedure when a character cannot be encoded with the current encoding.
An object that provides an error-handling procedure when a byte sequence cannot be decoded with the current encoding.
member.exception: is less than zero or greater than 65535.
is not supported by the underlying platform.
is not supported by the underlying platform.

member.summary: Returns the encoding associated with the specified code page name.
member.returns: The encoding associated with the specified code page.
member.param: The code page name of the preferred encoding. Any value returned by the property is valid. Possible values are listed in the Name column of the table that appears in the class topic.
member.exception: is not a valid code page name.-or- The code page indicated by is not supported by the underlying platform.
